articles.title: Kim Jong Un Watches Performance of State Merited Chorus
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Watches Performance of State Merited Chorus
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- A performance was given with splendor at the People's Theatre on Wednesday to mark the 70th anniversary of the founding of the State Merited Chorus.
					 Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, appeared in the auditorium.
					
					 Among the audience were KPA Vice Marshal Hwang Pyong So, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee, vice-chairman of the DPRK State Affairs Commission and director of the KPA General Political Bureau; Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK, vice-chairman of the DPRK State Affairs Commission and vice-chairman of the C.C., WPK; Kim Ki Nam, member of the Political Bureau of the C.C., WPK, member of the DPRK State Affairs Commission and vice-chairman of the C.C., WPK; and commanding officers of the KPA and officials, creators, journalists and editors in the fields of literature and arts and media of the KPA.
					
					 The performance began with the national anthem.
					
					 Its numbers included orchestral music and male chorus "Forever with the Leader and the Party" and "Serial Songs of Guerrillas" and female trio and male chorus "Greeting Spring on Jong Il Peak".
					
					 Performers made an impressive artistic representation of the majestic appearance of the revolutionary army's art troupe.
					
					 The performance, replete with the indomitable revolutionary idea of the WPK, the revolutionary spirit of Mt Paektu and the invincible might of great Kim Il Sung's and Kim Jong Il's Korea, reached the climax when the Chorus presented male chorus "Let's Defend Socialism" and "Our March".
					
					 It ended with orchestral music and male chorus "We Will Go along the Road of Loyalty". The performance fully demonstrated the faith and will of the army and people to win the final victory without fail in accomplishing the socialist cause of Juche, united close around respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un just as they had dynamically made a long journey of revolution, holding President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem.
					
					 The performance was highly acclaimed by the audience as it brought about a fresh phase of music representation through a combination of Korean-style orchestra, chorus and colorful vocal numbers.
					
					 Kim Jong Un expressed his great satisfaction over the revolutionary and militant performance staged by the State Merited Chorus and warmly congratulated all the members of the Chorus on its 70th founding anniversary.
					
					 Expressing belief that the Chorus would fully discharge its mission and duty as the core unit and engine of the Korean revolution and distinguished guerrilla bugler of the present times, he had a photo session with creators, artistes and leading members of the Chorus.

articles.title: Korean Jurists Committee Hits out at Malaysian Side's Unfriendly Attitude
articles.content:
Korean Jurists Committee Hits out at Malaysian Side's Unfriendly Attitude
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- A citizen of the DPRK bearing a diplomatic passport suddenly fell into a state of shock before boarding an airliner and died on the way to a hospital in Malaysia on February 13.
					 At that time the Foreign Ministry of Malaysia and the hospital side informed the DPRK embassy in Kuala Lumpur exercising the right to consular protection of DPRK citizens that they confirmed he died of heart stroke and decided to transfer his body to the embassy and get it cremated.
					
					 So the DPRK embassy confirmed his identity and asked the Malaysian side to transfer his body.
					
					 However, no sooner had south Korean conservative media published a false report that he was "poisoned to death", citing it as "source from the government" that night, than the Malaysian secret police got involved in the case and recklessly made it an established fact, only to make matters complicated.
					
					 The DPRK embassy made it clear that autopsy is not necessary as his death had already been confirmed as the one due to heart stroke and autopsy should never be done as he enjoyed extraterritorial right according to the Vienna Convention as a carrier of diplomatic passport. 
					
					 Nevertheless, the Malaysian side, in disregard of the DPRK's just demand and international law, made an autopsy of the body without any prior agreement with the DPRK side and its presence. Moreover, the Malaysian side clamored for the second autopsy without publishing the results of the first autopsy.
					
					 A spokesman for the Korean Jurists Committee in a statement on Wednesday termed this undisguised encroachment upon the sovereignty of the DPRK, a wanton human rights abuse and an act contrary to human ethics and morality.
					
					 The statement said:
					
					 What merits more serous attention is the fact that the unjust acts of the Malaysian side are timed to coincide with the anti-DPRK conspiratorial racket launched by the south Korean authorities.
					
					 Conservative media of south Korea began spreading wild rumors that the DPRK citizen was "poisoned to death by two women agents of the General Reconnaissance Bureau of north Korea" and it is undoubtedly its "deed" before the results of the autopsy were published.
					
					 On February 14, a day after his death, Chongwadae of south Korea kicked up a fuss over it and the south Korean authorities were busy holding a ministerial meeting on February 16, showing an excessive response. Moreover, they openly discussed the issue of THAAD deployment though it has nothing to do with the death of a DPRK citizen.
					
					 This proves that the south Korean authorities has long expected the case since it worked out a scenario for it.
					
					 It is, indeed, regretful that only Malaysia is denying such fact.
					
					 The biggest responsibility for his death rests with the government of Malaysia as the citizen of the DPRK died in its land.
					
					 The unfriendly attitude of the Malaysian side found a more striking manifestation in the matter of transferring his body to the DPRK side.
					
					 Malaysia is obliged to hand his body to the DPRK side as it made an autopsy and forensic examination of it in an illegal and immoral manner. However, it has not yet handed the body under the absurd pretext that it cannot do so unless the family of the deceased presents a DNA sample in accordance with its law.
					
					 This proves that the Malaysian side is going to politicize the transfer of the body in utter disregard of international law and morality and thus attain a sinister purpose.
					
					 In the early days when the incident happened Malaysia widely publicized that it arrested suspected persons but now keeps mum about it.
					
					 What sounds more alarming is that the suspected persons allegedly stated that the DPRK citizen was poisoned to death when "oil like lotion was put on his head with their hands." That means the woman survived even after having poison on her hand while leaving only the poisoned man dead.
					
					 The DPRK has already proposed a joint investigation for properly probing the incident and clarified that it is ready to dispatch a delegation of its jurists.
					
					 Its aim is to meet the suspected persons and hear their statements, confirm who ordered them and meet the arrested citizen and survey in detail the scene of the incident and its video footage and thus conclude the investigation into the incident in a fair way.
					
					 The DPRK will never allow any attempt to tarnish the image of the dignified power of independence and nuclear weapons state but make a thorough probe into the truth behind the case.
					
					 It will watch the future attitude of the Malaysian side.

articles.title: S. Korean Military Warned of Strong Counteractions against Reckless Provocations in West Sea
articles.content:
S. Korean Military Warned of Strong Counteractions against Reckless Provocations in West Sea
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- A touch-and-go situation is prevailing again in the hot spot waters of the West Sea of Korea.
					 On February 22 the south Korean belligerent forces let civilian boats repeatedly infiltrate into the waters of the DPRK under the pretext of building "man-made reefs" aimed at checking illegal fishing operations of boats from a third country and protecting aquatic resources in the waters off the five islands in the West Sea.
					
					 Such intrusion repeated 5 times and its depth reached 1.1 km that day alone.
					
					 What merits a serious attention is that such intrusion is being perpetrated under the open patronage and zealous wire-pulling of the U.S. imperialists.
					
					 U.S. imperialist aggressors appeared with a loudspeaker near the Military Demarcation Line at Panmunjom at dawn of Wednesday and staged a weird farce of "informing" the side of the Korean People's Army (KPA) of an operation to build "man-made reefs" in the waters off Yonphyong Island. Then they hurled a pack of hooligans into waters of the north side.
					
					 They sent even ghost-like "UN Forces"-flagged warships to the waters under the pretext of "monitoring the operation and ensuring security."
					
					 Buoyed by their master's encouragement, gangsters of the puppet military are blustering despite the warning served by the KPA that "it is an absurd accusation against their routine activities" and "it will be forced to pay dearly for threatening," deliberately escalating the tension.
					
					 The situation goes to prove that the intrusions are premeditated military provocations of the puppet forces to tide over the prevailing unprecedented crisis in south Korea by creating "security uneasiness and crisis."
					
					 The KPA has already warned that it would take a resolute counteraction against the aggressors engrossed in reckless military provocations in the waters of the West Sea where the DPRK's sovereignty is exercised.
					
					 If the U.S. and the south Korean puppet bellicose forces persist in foolhardy military provocations despite the repeated warnings served by the DPRK, they will be held wholly accountable for all catastrophic consequences to be entailed by them.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Leader of Iranian Islamic Revolution
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Leader of Iranian Islamic Revolution
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK who is heading a SPA delegation on an official visit to Iran and attending the 6th international meeting for support to the Palestinian people under way in this country, met and had talks with Seyed Ali Khamenei, leader of the Islamic Revolution of Iran, on February 21.
					 He conveyed the regards of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un to the leader of the Islamic Revolution of Iran.
					
					 Seyed Ali Khamenei expressed thanks for them and asked Choe to convey his heartfelt regards to Kim Jong Un.
					
					 On the same day, Choe also met with personages of different countries, including the parliamentary speakers of Palestine, Niger, Malaysia and Madagascar.

articles.title: DPRK Foreign Minister Meets Iranian Ambassador
articles.content:
DPRK Foreign Minister Meets Iranian Ambassador
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Ri Yong Ho, foreign minister of the DPRK, met and had a talk with new Iranian Ambassador to the DPRK Seyed Mohsen Emadi who paid a courtesy call on him on Thursday.
					 The foreign minister expressed his belief that the relations between the two countries would grow stronger, referring to the validity and vitality of the Workers' Party of Korea's strategic line of simultaneously pushing forward the economic construction and the building of nuclear force.
					
					 The Iranian ambassador said that they are pleased to see the bilateral relations, provided by the preceding leaders of the two countries, steadily developing on good terms under the deep care of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 He said that he would strive to develop the Iran-DPRK relations in politics, economy, culture and other fields during his tenure of office, noting that the two countries are closely cooperating with each other against the arbitrary and high-handed practices of the U.S. and other Western countries in the international arena, including the UN.
					
					 Present there were officials of the Foreign Ministry of the DPRK and a member of the Iranian embassy.

articles.title: Greetings to Sultan of Brunei on National Day
articles.content:
Greetings to Sultan of Brunei on National Day
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Ri Yong Ho Thursday sent a message of greeting to Haji Hassanal Bolkiah, sultan, head of state and minister of Foreign Affairs and Trade of Brunei Darussalam, on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message expressed the belief that the exchange and cooperation between the foreign ministries of the two countries and friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger and wished the sultan greater success in his work.

articles.title: Greetings to Sultan of Brunei
articles.content:
Greetings to Sultan of Brunei
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Thursday sent a message of greeting to Haji Hassanal Bolkiah, sultan and head of state of Brunei Darussalam, on the occasion of its national day.
					 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished the sultan good health and greater successes in his responsible work and the people of Brunei progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Traditional Friendly Relations with DPRK Will Go on: Namibian President
articles.content:
Traditional Friendly Relations with DPRK Will Go on: Namibian President
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- DPRK Ambassador Kim Chang Ryop presented credentials to Hage Geingob, president of the Republic of Namibia, on February 16.
					 The president thanked the government and people of the DPRK for having supported the cause of the government and people of Namibia.
					
					 He hoped that the Korean people would register bigger successes in the drive for building a socialist power and reunifying the country under the wise leadership of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The traditional friendly relations between the two countries will as ever favorably develop, he stressed.

articles.title: Russian Embassy Officials Visit Liberation Tower
articles.content:
Russian Embassy Officials Visit Liberation Tower
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Officials of the Russian embassy here laid a wreath at the Liberation Tower in Pyongyang on Thursday to mark the Day of Defenders of the Motherland.
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Ambassador Alexandr Matsegora, Military Attache Alexei Bartusov and staff members of the embassy.
					
					 After a wreath in the name of the Russian embassy was placed at Liberation Tower, the participants paid silent tribute to the fallen fighters of the Soviet Army. Then they looked round the tower.
					
					 They also laid a wreath and flowers at the cemetery of fallen fighters of the Soviet Army in Sadong District.
					
					 Earlier, officials of the embassy placed bouquets at the statues of Soviet soldiers and liberation towers in Nampho and Haeju cities.
					
					 Meanwhile, members of the Russian consulate general in Chongjin laid wreaths at the liberation tower and the cemetery of the fallen fighters of the Soviet Army in the city.

articles.title: Anniversary of State Merited Chorus Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of State Merited Chorus Marked
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The Sate Merited Chorus of the DPRK marked the 70th anniversary of its founding.
					 President Kim Il Sung organized an art organization of the army, the predecessor of the State Merited Chorus, on Feb. 22, Juche 36 (1947) as part of building the regular revolutionary armed forces.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il developed the Chorus into an independent art organization and world-level chorus by providing energetic guidance to it in the whole period of the Songun revolutionary leadership.
					
					 The Workers' Party of Korea projected the Chorus as the eldest art organization of the country leading the song of advance in the new century of Juche, engine of the Korean revolution and the biggest national treasure to make it fully display its might and prestige as a world-leading art troupe.
					
					 Cherishing intense loyalty and revolutionary soldier spirit, the creators, artistes and leading members of the Chorus have devotedly defended the party and the leader with signal successes in production and creation as befitting the first bugler of the Songun revolution and left clear marks in the history of the WPK's music-based politics. 
					
					 A meeting was held on Wednesday to mark the 70th anniversary of the Sate Merited Chorus.
					
					 Conveyed at the meeting was a congratulatory message of the WPK Central Committee to the creators, artistes and leading members of the Chorus.
					
					 Present there were Vice Marshal of the Korean People's Army Hwang Pyong So, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee, vice-chairman of the DPRK State Affairs Commission and director of the KPA General Political Bureau, and leading members, creators and artistes of the Chorus.

articles.title: National Calligraphy Festival Closes
articles.content:
National Calligraphy Festival Closes
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- A national calligraphy festival for celebrating the Day of the Shining Star, the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il, was closed with due ceremony at the Pyongyang International House of Culture on February 22.
					 The festival, opened on Feb. 8, well showed the Korean army and people's steadfast faith and will to hold President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in high esteem and surely build a socialist power under the guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Such calligraphic works were highly appreciated as "Eight famous scenes of the Sobaeksu Valley", "Our father", "Make selfless, devoted efforts for the good of the people", "Socialism is a science" and "Self-development capability".

articles.title: Lyocell-Fiber Production Technology Achieved
articles.content:
Lyocell-Fiber Production Technology Achieved
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- A research group of the Chemical Fiber Institution of the State Academy of Sciences in the DPRK succeeded in developing the Lyocell-fiber production technology based on reed pulp.
					 Lyocell-fiber has been regarded as a green fiber, an ideal synthetic fiber of the 21st century. And there are only few countries in the world that own its production technology.
					
					 The group designed and manufactured equipment for Lyocell-fiber production and made standard regulations of operation and technical rules for all the production processes.
					
					 With the completion of the Korean-style production technology, it is expected to mass-produce Lyocell-fiber.
					
					 Lyocell-fiber feels alike cotton and is well dyed.

articles.title: Active Hydrogen Generator Popular among Citizens
articles.content:
Active Hydrogen Generator Popular among Citizens
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The active hydrogen generator made by the Bioengineering Institute under the Life Science Faculty of Kim Il Sung University is enjoying popularity in the DPRK. 
					 Researchers of the institute confirmed the reaction process of generating active hydrogen in drinking water and put the method of making active hydrogen water on a scientific basis.
					
					 The active hydrogen generator is a medical appliance changing drinking water into active hydrogen water good for health.
					
					 It is about the size of a small dry cell and weighs 80 grams.
					
					 It is said that to drink 1.5-2 liters of active hydrogen water everyday is good for the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular diseases, digestive and urinary diseases, nervous system disorders, diabetes and cancer.
					
					 The method of generating active hydrogen and the generator were patented and highly appreciated at the intellectual product exhibition held last year.

articles.title: Neighboring Country's Mean Behavior: Written by Jong Phil
articles.content:
Neighboring Country's Mean Behavior: Written by Jong Phil
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The DPRK made a complete success in the test-fire of surface-to-surface medium to long-range strategic ballistic missile Pukguksong-2 on February 12 under the energetic guidance of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un. The news instantly jolted the world and the international community is acknowledging the nuclear attack capability of the DPRK that has made rapid progress in quality. 
					 Leading media of the world are unanimous in assessing that the acknowledged success in the test-fire of Pukguksong-2 was a demonstration of the DPRK's strategic superiority as it proved impossibility of advance detection by satellite, interception and preemptive attack.
					
					 However, a neighboring country, which often claims itself to be a "friendly neighbor", is downplaying the significance of the test-fire, branding it as a "nuclear technology just at the beginning" and threatening "the DPRK will suffer the biggest loss."
					
					 In particular, it has unhesitatingly taken inhumane steps such as totally blocking foreign trade related to the improvement of people's living standard under the plea of the UN "resolutions on sanctions" devoid of legal ground.
					
					 It has often stated that the UN "resolutions on sanctions" should not have negative impact on the people's living. Its recent measures are, in effect, tantamount to the enemies' moves to bring down the social system in the DPRK.
					
					 This country, styling itself a big power, is dancing to the tune of the U.S. while defending its mean behavior with such excuses that it was meant not to have a negative impact on the living of the people in the DPRK but to check its nuclear program.
					
					 The righteous voices of the world deride it, commenting that "a big neighboring country is imposing sanctions on the DPRK to curry favor with the U.S." But the hostile forces are shouting "bravo" over this.
					
					 The DPRK manufactured a nuclear weapon in a few years, which would take others tens of years, and completed the new latest strategic weapon system in a matter of six months with its own efforts and indigenous technology. This shows the might of its tremendous defence industry.
					
					 It is utterly childish to think that the DPRK would not manufacture nuclear weapons and inter-continental ballistic rockets if a few penny of money is cut off.
					
					 The DPRK will produce the latest weapons unprecedented in history as many as it wants as it has the self-reliant defence industry, provided by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il with their lifelong dedication, and scientists and technicians in the field of defence industry working hard in do-or-die spirit guided by the faith that the strategic idea and intention of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea must be put into practice.
					
					 These weapons would invest the DPRK with capabilities for protecting peace and stability in Northeast Asia and the rest of the world.
					
					 The present reality makes the people of the DPRK keenly feel once again the validity of the WPK's line of simultaneously pushing forward the economic construction and the building of nuclear force.
					
					 The DPRK will invariably advance straight along the road indicated by the Party's line and deal a heavy blow to the U.S. and its vassal forces by dint of powerful nuclear deterrence and thus win the final victory.

articles.title: No One Can Fault DPRK's Measures for Self-Defense: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
No One Can Fault DPRK's Measures for Self-Defense: Rodong Sinmun
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The DPRK, a country technically at war with the U.S., the biggest nuclear weapons state in the world, and exposed to the constant nuclear threat from it, is more urgently required than other countries to bolster nuclear force, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a commentary. 
					 This being a hard reality, the U.S. is steadily making silly jargons while pulling up the DPRK's measures for self-defense, it says, adding:
					
					 The DPRK declared that the preparations for the test-fire of inter-continental ballistic missile have reached the final phase. The U.S. termed it a "provocation" and denounced the DPRK for posing threat.
					
					 In recent days, it held a drill of intercepting the DPRK's rockets together with Japan and the south Korean puppet forces. This is no more than a deliberate act aimed to escalate the situation on the Korean peninsula to an extreme phase and shift the blame on to the DPRK.
					
					 The DPRK's rocket launch is a legitimate right from A to Z.
					
					 It is claimed that it does not present any problem for other countries including the U.S. to launch missiles at any time, but it is a violation of law for the DPRK to conduct the test-fire for self-defense. This is quite unreasonable.
					
					 No one should fault the DPRK's measures for self-defense. If U.S. and its stooges work hard to slander and put pressure upon the DPRK, the latter cannot but take a step of stronger physical counteraction. This is the legitimate right.
					
					 The DPRK will fully exercise the right to defend the sovereignty of the country and the dignity of the nation no matter what others may say.

articles.title: Passage of Anti-Media Control Bill through NA Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Passage of Anti-Media Control Bill through NA Demanded in S. Korea
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Members of the press trade union in south Korea held a press conference in demand of the passage of anti-media control bill through "National Assembly" on Feb. 21, according to the south Korean paper Nodong and Segye. 
					 Speakers at the conference noted that lawmakers from opposition parties demand the passage but some ruling party lawmakers are evading the issue.
					
					 To block the passage is an intention to use MBC and KBS as trophies, they said, demanding the passage for the revival of freedom of media.
					
					 They declared their will to make public the politicians who blocked the passage of the bill and surely open the era of fair media.

articles.title: Prompt Impeachment of Park Is Demand of People: S. Korean Professors and Researchers
articles.content:
Prompt Impeachment of Park Is Demand of People: S. Korean Professors and Researchers
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The Emergency Situation Council of Professors and Researchers of south Korea held a meeting in Seoul on Feb. 20, demanding the impeachment of traitor Park Geun Hye, according to the south Korean internet paper Chamsesang.
					 At the meeting speakers said that Park, her accomplices and those patronizing her are building up the public opinion in their favor while talking about "theory of security crisis" and "coloring theory" though they have been ordered by the people to step down.
					
					 They stressed the need to clearly probe the truth about abuse of power and build a society where the people have become master. They also urged the "National Assembly" not to waver before the conservative forces' anachronistic moves.

articles.title: Struggle for Forcing Park Geun Hye to Step down Waged by S. Korean Students
articles.content:
Struggle for Forcing Park Geun Hye to Step down Waged by S. Korean Students
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The situation council of students demanding the Park Geun Hye regime's resignation, comprising 82 general students councils and 51 students movement organizations in south Korea, called a press conference in Seoul on February 20 to demand the traitorous regime's resignation, according to the south Korean online newspaper Jaju Sibo.
					 The organization at the press conference said that it would hold a general rally of students as a prearranged meeting for all-people rally due on February 25 and wage a candlelight struggle ahead of the start of the school term in March.
					
					 It said that each university would make a declaration on the situation, together with its professors.

articles.title: Koreans in U.S. Demand Detention of Park Geun Hye
articles.content:
Koreans in U.S. Demand Detention of Park Geun Hye
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Koreans residing in Los Angeles of the U.S. held a rally on Feb. 18 in demand of the resignation of Park Geun Hye and democratization of south Korean society.
					 Speakers said that the Park Geun Hye group branded candlelight demonstrators as "followers of the north", but the candlelight action is getting stronger.
					
					 Park's crimes have already been disclosed and the "National Assembly" passed the motion on her impeachment, but Park and her accomplices are still remaining in power, they charged.
					
					 A statement was read out at the rally.
					
					 It said that though the period of the special investigation nearly came to the end, Park and her yes man Hwang Kyo An are making desperate efforts to get the impeachment bill dismissed.
					
					 It called for holding the righteous candlelight in solidarity with the compatriots in south Korea steadily waging the action for Park's resignation.

articles.title: Kimjongilia Exhibitions Held Abroad
articles.content:
Kimjongilia Exhibitions Held Abroad
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Kimjongilia exhibitions took place in Russia, China and Mongolia from February 8 to 16 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 On display at the venues of the exhibitions were hundreds of potted Kimjongilias, works of the peerlessly great men of Mt Paektu and books and photos showing the situation in the DPRK.
					
					 Present at the opening ceremonies were personages and masses in those countries.
					
					 The mayor of Partizansk of Russia said the progressive people are boundlessly revering Comrade Kim Jong Il, an incarnation of peace and love, adding he keenly realized the noble personality of the peerlessly great men through the fact that the friends of the Korean people are cultivating Kimjongilias with much care.
					
					 The first secretary of the Partizansk City Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation who is member of the Maritime Territorial Legislative Assembly of Russia said he more deeply realized the personality of Kim Jong Il as a great man possessed of boundless tenderness while seeing Kimjongilias in full bloom despite the biting cold in the Far East.
					
					 The chief of the Dalian City Flower Association said it is of great significance to hold the exhibition to mark the birth anniversary of General Kim Jong Il, reiterating the will to widely disseminate the immortal flower.
					
					 The chairperson of the Kimjongilia Association of Mongolia praised Kim Jong Il as a patriot who dedicated himself to the happiness of the people and reunification of the country till the last moments of his life.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Published in Russia
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il's work "On the Juche Idea" was brought out in booklet by the Nakhodka Format Publishing House of Russia on the occasion of the Day of the Shining Star (Feb 16), his birth anniversary.
					 The work published on March 31, Juche 71 (1982) deals with the immortal historic exploits of President Kim Il Sung who founded the Juche idea, its significance, and the founding, philosophical, socio-historic and guiding principles and historical significance of the Juche idea.
					
					 A book-releasing ceremony took place at the publishing house on Feb. 9.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Brief Biography Posted by Czech Organization on Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Brief Biography Posted by Czech Organization on Website
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- A brief biography of leader Kim Jong Il was posted by the Paektusan Czech-Korean Friendship Association on its website on Feb. 16.
					 The website carried his photos.

articles.title: Youth Group for Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism Formed in Mexico
articles.content:
Youth Group for Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism Formed in Mexico
Pyongyang, February 23 (KCNA) -- The Youth Group of the Mexican Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism was formed on Feb. 15 on the occasion of the birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il.
					 Hector Eduardo Cruz Flores was elected chairman of the group.
					
					 The group discussed matters for actively studying and disseminating Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism.

articles.title: Efectuada la funcion de Coro Estatal Benemerito en presencia de Kim Jong Un
articles.content:
Efectuada la funcion de Coro Estatal Benemerito en presencia de Kim Jong Un
Pyongyang, 23 de febrero (ACNC) -- Se ofrecio con solemnidad el dia 22 en el Teatro de Pueblo la funcion por el 70o aniversario de la fundacion del Coro Estatal Benemerito (CEB).
					El Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, salio al asiento del espectador.
					
					Lo vieron tambien el vicemariscal del EPC Hwang Pyong So, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del PTC, vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la RPDC y jefe de la Direccion Politica General del EPC, Choe Ryong Hae, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y vicepresidente del Comite de Estado de la RPDC y del CC del PTC, Kim Ki Nam, miembro del Buro Politico del CC del PTC y del Comite de Estado de la RPDC y vicepresidente del CC del PTC y los miembros de mando del EPC, los funcionarios de los dominios de literatura, arte, prensa e informacion, los creadores, periodistas y redactores del EPC.
					
					En la funcion iniciada con el Himno Patriotico se ofrecieron la musica orquestal y el coro masculino "Largo camino bajo el mando del Presidente y siguiendo al Partido", el trio femenino y el coro masculino "Acogida de primavera en el pico Jong Il" y otras piezas.
					
					Los artistas militares mostraron con emocion en la escena artistica el aspecto majestuoso de la entidad artistica del ejercito revolucionario.
					
					La funcion artistica, llena de la firme idea revolucionaria de nuestro partido, el espiritu revolucionario del Paektu y el poderio invencible de Corea de Kim Il Sung y Kim Jong Il, se llego al climax con el coro masculino "Defendamos el socialismo" y "Nuestra marcha".
					
					El espectaculo terminado con la musica orquestal y el coro masculino "Marcharemos por el unico camino de fidelidad" mostro patentemente la conviccion y voluntad del ejercito y pueblo coreanos para lograr sin falta la victoria final de la causa socialista del Juche uniendose monoliticamente en torno al Maximo Dirigente al igual que han venido marchando con pasos firmes por el largo camino de la revolucion enalteciendo al Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					Los espectadores elogiaron calurosamente la funcion que creo la interpretacion musical de nuevo plano mediante la combinacion de la musica orquestal, el coro a estilo coreano y variadas piezas de musica vocal.
					
					El Maximo Dirigente mostro una gran satisfaccion de que los artistas ofrecieron la funcion revolucionaria y combativa y felicito calurosamente a todos los miembros del CEB que celebran el 70o aniversario de su fundacion.
					
					Expresando la esperanza y conviccion de que en el futuro tambien el CEB cumplira con su mision y deber como unidad medular y la locomotora de la revolucion coreana y trompetero guerrillero de hoy, el Maximo Dirigente se fotografio junto a los creadores, artistas y miembros de mando de la entidad artistica.

articles.title: Comite de Juristas de Corea condena la actitud hostil de Malasia
articles.content:
Comite de Juristas de Corea condena la actitud hostil de Malasia
Pyongyang, 23 de febrero (ACNC) -- El 13 de febrero, un ciudadano de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea quien poseyo el pasaporte diplomatico, se puso inesperadamente en choque en visperas de la subida al avion y se fallecio en el camino de trasladarse al hospital.
					Al principio, el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de Malasia y la parte del hospital confirmaron el hecho de que esta muerte fue causada por el ataque cardiaco a la Embajada de la RPDC en Malasia que ejerce el derecho de proteccion consular para el ciudadano coreano e informaron la decision de transferir el cadaver para incinerarlo.
					
					Por eso, la embajada coreana confirmo la identidad del fallecido y demando entregar el cadaver.
					
					Pero, ese dia por la noche una prensa conservadora del Sur de Corea insistio en que segun la "fuente gubernamental" eso fue ocasionado por el "envenenamiento" por alguien. Como estaba esperandolo la policia secreta de Malasia lo hizo sin ton ni son como un hecho consumado y propuso el problema de autopsia del cadaver creando complejidades del caso.
					
					La Embajada de la RPDC aclaro la posicion de que no hay necesidad de hacer autopsia porque fue confirmado como muerte por el choque cardiaco y que no puede hacerlo porque el fallecido es poseedor del pasaporte diplomatico que es el objeto de jurisdiccion extraterritorial segun el Convenio de Viena.
					
					Pero, la parte de Malasia realizo la autopsia del cadaver sin ningun acuerdo con la parte coreana ni presencia de esta despreciando nuestra demanda justa y la ley internacional e insistio en la necesidad de la segunda autopsia sin publicar el resultado de la primera prueba.
					
					Esto deviene la abierta violacion a la soberania de la RPDC y a los derechos humanos y un acto antietico.
					
					Asi condena el vocero del Comite de Juristas de Corea en su declaracion del dia 22 y continua:
					
					Lo que no podemos pasar por alto es que tales actos injustos de la parte malasiana se coinciden en el mismo tiempo con los alborotos de intriga de las autoridades surcoreanas contra la RPDC.
					
					Antes de ser publicado el resultado de autopsia los medios de prensa conservadores del Sur de Corea empezaron a divulgar con teson los rumores del "envenenamiento por las dos agentes del Buro General de Reconocimiento del Norte de Corea" y de la "innegable maniobra del Norte de Corea", etc.
					
					Se manifesto muy claramente la reaccion de las autoridades surcoreanas: el dia 14, un dia despues del caso, Chongwadae empezo a hacer bulla y se realizo el dia 16 la reunion a nivel ministerial y, al fin y al cabo, discutieron abiertamente hasta el emplazamiento de "THAAD", asunto que no tiene ninguna relacion con la muerte de nuestro ciudadano.
					
					Esto muestra claramente el hecho de que las autoridades surcoreanas estan previendo este caso y preparando hasta su guion.
					
					Pero, solo Malasia da espaldas a tales hechos, lo cual resulta muy lamentable.
					
					El gobierno malasiano tiene mayor responsabilidad del caso porque el ciudadano de la RPDC murio en el territorio de Malasia.
					
					La conducta hostil de Malasia se manifesto mas claramente en el problema de transferencia del cadaver.
					
					Ese pais, que hizo de modo ilegal e inmoral el examen de medicina legal, deberia volver merecidamente el cadaver a la parte coreana. Pero, todavia no lo entrega presentando el pretexto absurdo de que es imposible trasladarlo antes de que la familia del muerto presente la muestra de DNA segun la ley de Malasia. 
					
					Esto demuestra que la parte de Malasia persigue alcanzar un objeto malsano politizando el problema de traslado del cadaver sin tomar en consideracion la ley internacional y la etica y la moralidad.
					
					Tambien, a principios del caso, Malasia hablo ruidosamente de que detuvieron el sospechoso del asesinato. Pero, despues no refiere nada al respecto.
					
					Lo mas ridiculo es la insistencia en que el fallecido fue envenenado por un liquido igual con un aceite que untaron con la palma de mano a la cabeza del muerto. Entonces, ?por que no murio esa mujer que engraso ese liquido en su mano?
					
					Ya hemos planteado la investigacion conjunta por la aclaracion correcta de este caso y aclaramos la posicion de que estamos preparados para enviar la delegacion de juristas.
					
					Queremos enviar al terreno la delegacion de juristas para escuchar la declaracion de los presuntos de asesinato, verificar a los autores del caso, encontrarse con nuestro ciudadano arrestado e investigar detalladamente el terreno del caso y los datos de video, asi como concluir imparcialmente la investigacion del caso.
					
					No perdonaremos jamas cualquier intento de manchar la imagen digna de la potencia independiente y la nuclear, sino descubriremos hasta el fin los secretos de este incidente.
					
					Observaremos la conducta futura de Malasia.

articles.title: Maniobras militares de agresores en zona candente del Mar Oeste
articles.content:
Maniobras militares de agresores en zona candente del Mar Oeste
Pyongyang, 23 de febrero (ACNC) -- Vuelve a crearse la peligrosa crisis de choque militar en la zona candente del Mar Oeste.
					El dia 22, las fuerzas belicistas del Sur de Corea hicieron que los barcos civiles invadieran sucesivamente las aguas jurisdiccionales de la parte Norte bajo el pretexto de instalar el "escollo artificial" para impedir la pesca ilegal de los barcos del tercer pais y proteger los recursos de peces en los alrededores de 5 islas del Mar Oeste.
					
					Solo en este dia, los barcos surcoreanos invadieron en 5 ocasiones hasta 1.1km de las aguas territoriales de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Lo mas grave del caso es que tales maniobras se perpetran bajo el abrigo abierto e instigacion activa de los imperialistas norteamericanos.
					
					A la madrugada del dia 22, los agresores norteamericanos aparecieron con altavoz a la Linea de Demarcacion Militar en Phanmunjom e hizo una "informacion" sobre la instalacion del "escollo artificial" en las aguas cercanas de la isla Yonphyong. Y lanzaron a muchos bandidos militares a la zona maritima de la RPDC.
					
					Para colmo, enviaron a esta zona los buques con bandera de "fuerzas de ONU" bajo el rotulo de "la vigilancia del trabajo y el aseguramiento de seguridad".
					
					Pese a las advertencias de la RPDC los gangsteres militares surcoreanos, instigados por su amo gringo, agravan intencionalmente la situacion insistiendo en "las actividades normales" y lanzando disparates que "la amenaza pagara el precio grave".
					
					Este suceso deviene la provocacion militar premeditada de los titeres surcoreanos para crear la "inquietud y crisis de seguridad" y asi salvar la situacion surcoreana de la crisis sin precedente.
					
					Nuestro ejercito ya advirtio que dara castigo resuelto a los agresores que actuan freneticamente por la imprudente provocacion militar en la zona maritima del Mar Oeste de Corea donde se ejerce la soberania de la RPDC.
					
					Si los belicistas norteamericanos y surcoreanos siguen recurriendo a las provocaciones militares pese a las reiteradas advertencias de la RPDC, seran responsables de todas las consecuencias catastroficas que se ocasionaran por ellas.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita Dia Nacional de Brunei Darussalam
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita Dia Nacional de Brunei Darussalam
Pyongyang, 23 de febrero (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 23 un mensaje de felicitacion al sultan y jefe de Estado de Brunei Darussalam, Haji Hassanal Bolkiah, con motivo del Dia Nacional de este pais.
					En su misiva, el remitente expresa su conviccion de que se desarrollaran mas las relaciones de amistad entre los dos paises y le desea al destinatario buena salud y mayores exitos en sus trabajos responsables y el progreso y prosperidad al pueblo.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok se reune con Seyed Ali Khamenei
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok se reune con Seyed Ali Khamenei
Pyongyang, 23 de febrero (ACNC) -- El presidente de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Choe Thae Bok, quien al presidir la delegacion de la APS de la RPDC realiza una visita oficial a la Republica Islamica de Iran y participa en la 6a conferencia internacional de apoyo al pueblo palestino efectuado en este Iran, departio el dia 21 con el lider de la Revolucion Islamica de Iran, Seyed Ali Khamenei. 
					El visitante coreano traslado cortesmente el saludo del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un a Seyed Ali Khamenei. 
					
					Khamenei expreso el profundo agradecimiento por el respecto y le encomendo que transmitiera su sincero saludo al Maximo Dirigente. 
					
					El mismo dia, el se reunio por separados con los presidentes de los Parlamentos del Estado de Palestina, la Republica de Niger, Malasia y la Republica de Madagascar y otras personalidades.

articles.title: Coreanos residentes en EE.UU. demandan dimision y detencion de Park Geun-hye
articles.content:
Coreanos residentes en EE.UU. demandan dimision y detencion de Park Geun-hye
Pyongyang, 23 de febrero (ACNC) -- Los coreanos residentes en Los Angeles de Estados Unidos organizaron el dia 18 un mitin demandando la retirada de Park Geun-hye y la democratizacion de la sociedad surcoreana.
					En la ocasion los oradores dijeron que en el Sur de Corea se avivan cada dia mas furiosamente las velas aunque los compinches de Park califican de las "fuerzas subordinadas al Norte" a los manifestantes con velas encendidas.
					
					Denunciaron a Park y sus complices que ocupan todavia el poder aunque ya fueron revelados los crimenes de Park y quedo aprobado el proyecto de su dimision en la "Asamblea Nacional".
					
					En el mitin fue leida la declaracion.
					
					La banda de Park acecha la oportunidad para restituir el poder llevando al fracaso la dimision, revela el documento y denuncia a los partidos opositores que se determinaron a aceptar la denegacion del proyecto de dimision, burlando la opinion publica.
					
					Aunque esta venciendo el plazo de la inspeccion especial, no detienen a Park Geun-hye, insiste y denuncia a esta traidora y Hwang Kyo An que se valen de todas las ardides para denegarse el proyecto de dimision.
					
					Exhorta a levantar las velas justas para solidarizarse con los surcoreanos que luchan por la retirada de Park Geun-hye.
